backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing tournament management with authorization, access control, and CRUD operations for tournaments, groups, stages, and user profiles; includes helpers for converting mutable state to immutable views and ownership checks.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting two high-confidence features: tournament loading mechanism fixes in TournamentListDialog and tournament deserialization logic verification in useTournamentStore with associated test IDs and component dependencies.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend TypeScript/TSX files covering tournament state management, generation logic, UI components, pages, and validation utilities with details on recent fixes and enhancements.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes defining colors for UI elements (background, foreground, primary, secondary, destructive, borders, charts, sidebar) using OKLCH color space.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the React application with viewport meta tag and title describing a multi-stage cricket tournament draw app with round-robin and knockout stages.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component rendering AppHeader and conditionally displaying TournamentSetupPage, StageSchedulePage, FullSchedulePage, KnockoutPage, or UserProfilePage based on currentView state with toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/AdvancementConfi: Modal dialog component for configuring stage advancement rules allowing users to set winner and runner-up destinations (NextStage, KnockoutEntry, or Eliminated) with validation and conditional UI based on stage position.
frontend/src/components/AppHeader.tsx: Application header component with Tournament Manager branding, Profile button, and Login/Logout button integrating Internet Identity authentication and navigation to profile view.
frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx: Shared layout wrapper providing responsive container with gradient background, consistent padding, and footer with caffeine.ai attribution link and copyright notice.
frontend/src/components/DeleteTournament: A confirmation dialog component that handles tournament deletion with loading states and success/error toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/KnockoutPairingE: Manages knockout stage pairing configuration with auto/manual modes, team assignment to matches, validation warnings, and rematch avoidance logic.
frontend/src/components/KnockoutWinnerSe: Displays buttons to select the winner of a knockout match, hiding the selector if either team is a placeholder (TBD).
frontend/src/components/MatchDateTimeEdi: Provides date and time input fields for editing match scheduling information.
frontend/src/components/NewTournamentBut: A button that resets the tournament state, showing a confirmation dialog if a tournament has already been generated.
frontend/src/components/RoundRobinGroupT: Displays round-robin groups in a grid with inline editing for team names, positions, and group names, including origin group serial display.
frontend/src/components/SaveTournamentDi: A dialog for saving tournament configurations either as a new tournament or updating an existing one, serializing groups and stages to the backend.
frontend/src/components/Stage2GroupAssig: Visualizes the flow of teams between round-robin stages and knockout, showing winner and runner-up destinations for each stage.
frontend/src/components/TournamentListDi: Dialog component for managing tournaments with table view, allowing users to load, rename, and delete saved tournaments with inline editing and confirmation dialogs.
frontend/src/components/UserTournamentCa: Card component displaying tournament summary (name, creation date, groups, stages) with a load button to deserialize and load the tournament into the store.
frontend/src/features/tournament/deseria: Deserializes backend TournamentView data into frontend tournament state, reconstructing groups, stages, advancement configs, round robin rounds, and knockout stage configuration.
Frontend-only utility to export Robin Round 1 stage groups and teams to a downloadable JSON file without backend calls.
frontend/src/features/tournament/generat: Generates multi-stage round-robin tournament structures with deterministic seeding, creating groups and matches based on round configs and advancement rules.
frontend/src/features/tournament/groupNa: Generates Excel-style alphabetical group names (A-Z, AA-AZ, BA-BZ, etc.) supporting unlimited groups across tournament rounds.
frontend/src/features/tournament/groupRe: Reorders teams within a group by moving a team to a target position, maintaining unique positions 1 through N.
frontend/src/features/tournament/knockou: Generates knockout fixture codes (PQ1, Q2, S1, F1) for matches based on round name and index within the round.
Generates knockout stage matches from qualified round-robin teams, supporting multiple pairing modes (winner-vs-runner-up, reseeding) and fixture assignments with validation warnings.
Provides utilities to detect, normalize, and display placeholder team names (TBD, fixture codes like PQ1/Q2/S1/F1, or legacy 'Winner of X' patterns) in knockout brackets.
Implements knockout bracket reseeding logic that optimizes team placement to avoid rematches, same-group matchups, and winner-vs-winner pairings, with scoring and warning generation.
Defines canonical knockout round constants (Pre-Quarterfinal, Quarterfinal, Semifinal, Final) with ordering and utilities for round name validation and indexing.
Handles propagation of knockout match winners through the bracket using stable upstream fixture references, and clears downstream winners when upstream results change.
frontend/src/features/tournament/matchCo: Calculates total match counts and breakdowns for round-robin and knockout stages based on team count, group configurations, and advancement rules.
frontend/src/features/tournament/originG: Resolves a team's origin group serial (e.g., 'A-2') by finding the earliest stage where the team appears, used for team display formatting.
frontend/src/features/tournament/qualifi: Computes qualified teams for knockout stages based on per-stage advancement configurations, determining which winners and runner-ups advance to knockout entry points.
frontend/src/features/tournament/roundRo: Generates display codes (e.g., 'A1') for teams in round-robin matches based on group position, with special handling for Stage 2 using origin group serials.
Generates all unique round-robin match pairings for a given group by creating matches between every pair of teams.
frontend/src/features/tournament/seriali: Serializes tournament stages and groups into backend-compatible types, converting advancement rules (NextStage, KnockoutEntry, Eliminated) and round-robin configurations to the backend's StageType format.
frontend/src/features/tournament/types.t: Defines TypeScript types for tournament entities including teams, groups, matches, stages, advancement configurations, knockout stages, and the main TournamentState interface with multi-round and knockout support.
frontend/src/features/tournament/useTour: Zustand store managing tournament state with persistence, including team/match management, round-robin and knockout configuration, advancement rules, fixture assignments, and tournament generation/loading logic with migration support.
frontend/src/features/tournament/validat: Provides validation functions for tournament configuration including team counts, group counts, round configs, advancement rule compatibility, and date/time formats, plus helper functions for formatting advancement destinations.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance with authentication, automatically invalidating and refetching dependent queries when the actor changes due to identity updates.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for tournament CRUD operations (get, create, update, delete) and user profile management, integrating with the backend actor and handling query invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration file defining CSS custom properties for light and dark themes, including colors for UI components (primary, secondary, destructive, etc.) and chart colors.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient for data fetching and InternetIdentityProvider for authentication, then renders the App component.
frontend/src/pages/FullSchedulePage.tsx: Displays complete tournament schedule including round-robin and knockout stages with match details, winner selection, and save functionality requiring Internet Identity authentication.
frontend/src/pages/KnockoutPage.tsx: Manages knockout stage view with match brackets organized by rounds, winner selection, validation of qualified team counts, and tournament reset functionality.
frontend/src/pages/StageSchedulePage.tsx: Displays round-robin group stages with editable group and team names, provides navigation to full schedule view, and includes reset functionality with confirmation dialog.
frontend/src/pages/TournamentSetupPage.t: Main tournament configuration page for setting team count, round-robin rounds, group counts, advancement rules, knockout stages, and includes save/load/reset functionality with validation.
frontend/src/pages/UserProfilePage.tsx: User profile management page displaying username, join date, privacy settings, and user's tournaments list, requiring Internet Identity authentication to access.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, storing, and managing URL parameters from both regular query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support and methods to clear parameters from URLs.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color schemes using OKLCH color space, container settings, border radius variables, custom animations for accordions, and typography/container-queries plugins.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file documenting a cricket tournament management app with known issues around tournament loading functionality (data not populating after load) and previous delete button errors.
